Indications and doses

Dry cough,

By mouth using linctus

  • For adults
    5–10 mg 3–4 times a day.
  • For children 6–11 years
    2–5 mg 3–4 times a day.
  • For children 12–17 years
    5–10 mg 3–4 times a day.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid unless potential benefit outweighs risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Avoid in hepatic impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution in renal impairment.

Avoid in severe renal impairment.

Contra indications

  • Bronchiectasis
  • children: bronchiolitis in children
  • chronic bronchitis
  • adults: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in adults
  • patients at risk of respiratory failure

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Confusion, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, excitation, nausea, rash, sputum retention, vomiting,

Important safety information

MHRA/CHM advice (March 2008 and February 2009) Over-the-counter cough and cold medicines for children

Children under 6 years should not be given over-the-counter cough and cold medicines containing pholcodine (cough suppressant).

Over-the-counter cough and cold medicines can be considered for children aged 6–12 years after basic principles of best care have been tried, but treatment should be restricted to 5 days or less. Children should not be given more than 1 cough or cold preparation at a time because different brands may contain the same active ingredient; care should be taken to give the correct dose.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Asthma
  • chronic cough
  • persistent cough
  • productive cough

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Pholcodine is not generally recommended for children.

Flavours of oral liquid formulations may include orange.

Prepared medicinal forms of PHOLCODINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Oral solution
